Title: üñº A new regime for the expulsion of illegal migrants has begun t...
Description: A new regime for the expulsion of illegal migrants has come into effect in Russia On February 5, the regime for expulsion for foreigners illegally staying in the country came into force in Russia. They will be entered into the register of controlled persons, which involves a number of restrictions and prohibitions before subsequent deportation. The register is posted on the official website of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and is available in the public domain. A foreigner is considered to be notified of inclusion in the list from the moment the data is published. Persons included in the register will not be able to change their place of residence without permission from the Ministry of Internal Affairs, travel outside the region, drive vehicles, purchase property, register real estate in the cadastral register, open bank accounts and make financial transactions. In addition, such migrants are required to appear at the Ministry of Internal Affairs upon request. In the event of a double violation of the established restrictions, they are deported and placed in a special institution of the department. Also, from February 5, employees of the Ministry of Internal Affairs received the right to independently expel foreign citizens from the country for violations provided for by the Code of Administrative Offences. These powers were given to the heads of territorial police bodies and their deputies, as well as the heads of departments for migration and drug control. The decision on deportation for violating the rules of stay can now be made by the heads of the transport police.

Title: üñº In January, Russian far-right groups carried out 118 attacks. ...
Description: Russian far-right groups carried out 118 attacks in January. In 91 cases, the motive was racism - NVMPNVMP project, which collects and archives video evidence of hate crimes published by Russian far-right in TG channels, recorded 85 videos with 118 attacks on people and property in January 2025. Including 16 videos of spray cans, 23 - with beatings, 8 with flare guns. Five attacks involved a hammer, including an attack with a hammer on a housing and communal services worker in Ramenskoye, a beating of a child by teenagers, and four group beatings of passers-by. Their victims were people whom the attackers mistook for -non-Slavs- and their property. In addition to people resembling Central Asia and the Caucasus, Roma property was attacked 4 times, people of Asian appearance 4 times, people looking South Asian twice, and an African once.B 7 In some cases, the attack was motivated by religious hatred: the attackers cut the wheels of cars with Islamic stickers and smashed the windows of halal food stalls. Also, 7 videos recorded attacks on people whom the far right called anti-fascists, including one child. In three cases, the attacks were carried out on people of Slavic appearance, who were called -pedophiles-. Based on the -cleansing of the nation- motive, two attacks were carried out: one on a drunken man, and the second on a homeless man. The motive for the 7 attacks remained unknown,- the publication said. The project notes that among professional groups, couriers most often became victims of attacks. Janitors, housing and communal services employees and sellers at kiosks were also attacked. Only four arrests are known.

The numbers in the name of such bombs indicate the total weight of the product.At the beginning of July 2023, FAB-3000 fell for the first time from a Russian plane in the Belgorod region. Title: üñº -The doctors said: it‚Äôs okay, he won‚Äôt die-: high school stude...
Description: -The doctors said: it‚Äôs okay, he won‚Äôt die-: high school student Yegor Balazeikin, convicted of setting fire to military registration and enlistment offices, was denied sick leave in the colony, despite his deteriorating condition and disability 18-year-old political prisoner Yegor Balazeikin continues to suffer from deteriorating health in the colony. On February 1, during a long visit with his parents, his body reacted strongly to regular food, which differed from the prison diet. According to activists, for three days after the meeting, Yegor could not get out of bed and was in such bad condition that he could barely stand on his feet. On February 3, the support group reported that Yegor was denied sick leave, despite his deteriorating health. He did not receive the necessary tests that should have been done in December, and problems with his spine reappeared. -Egor went to the doctor, but they refused to give him sick leave, they said that it was okay, that he wouldn‚Äôt die. They gave him some strange pills, and the antibiotic turned out to be not for him, but for another prisoner. For three days he ate practically nothing, drinking only tea. When I returned to the detachment, my condition did not improve. Since it was Saturday, and doctors don‚Äôt work on weekends, he was given activated charcoal and the drugs that I brought for the date. Yesterday, he said, it got even worse, he started vomiting, and his stomach hurt a lot. He went to see a doctor again, but there was no improvement, he was not given sick leave,- Tatyana, the political prisoner‚Äôs mother, told ASTRA. She added that she was worried, not understanding the exact reason for the deterioration of her son‚Äôs condition. -We brought medicine with us, but it is still unclear how to treat him. Maybe it was an intestinal infection or a virus, or maybe just indigestion from the fact that his body was not used to normal food after prison food. He never received the necessary tests, and I don‚Äôt know what to tell him for the next date,- she said, emphasizing that without tests it is impossible to determine the correct treatment. According to the latest reports from the support group, Yegor's condition is still improving. -Egor felt better. I started eating a little. The abdominal pain goes away, the vomiting has stopped,-‚Äî representatives of the group wrote in their Telegram channel.In November 2023, the court sentenced Balazeikin to six years in prison in the case of throwing a Molotov cocktail at the St. Petersburg military registration and enlistment office. Memorial recognized him as a political prisoner. During the trial, he admitted the fact of arson, but stated that he did not intend to intimidate people or cause damage. After reaching adulthood, Yegor was transferred to an adult colony, despite his health condition. In May 2024, he was included in the list of terrorists and extremists, and the Memorial Project recognized him as a political prisoner. Description: The authorities want to nationalize Domodedovo Airport The Prosecutor General's Office of the Russian Federation filed a lawsuit with the Arbitration Court of the Moscow Region demanding that 100% of the shares of DME Holding LLC, which owns the airport, be transferred to the state. The lawsuit is directed to 32 airport structures, its owner Dmitry Kamenshchik and chairman of the supervisory board Valery Kogan. As Vedomosti writes, the Prosecutor General's Office believes that the group of companies at Domodedovo Airport was under the control of -residents of foreign states- - Dmitry Kamenshchik (Turkey, UAE) and Valery Kogan (Israel ). The lawsuit states that Kamenshchik and Kogan were supposed to gain control over the Russian strategic asset only if there was a decision from a government commission (they allegedly did not apply for it). The possibility of nationalizing the airport was already discussed after the terrorist attack at Domodedovo in 2011. In 2015, a criminal case was opened against Kamenshchik under the article on the provision of services that do not meet safety requirements, resulting in the death of two or more people. The case was later dropped.
